chapters.title: Chapter 1 — First Camp, First Helpers (Lv 1–6)
chapters.why: Start near Plateau of Beginnings. Build a safe mini-base and catch versatile early Pals so a second grader can explore without overwhelm.

steps.text: Place Palbox, Feed Box, and Straw Pal Beds.
Place a Berry Plantation for food security.
When Tech 7 unlocks, add a Logging Site and Stone Pit.
Craft Stone tools and a Bow. Plan to upgrade to Crossbow later.
Unlock and build the Pal Gear Workbench (Tech Lv 6) for saddles/partner gear.
Build a Statue of Power (Tech Lv 6) and feed it Lifmunk Effigies to raise Capture Power.
Catch Lamball or Cattiva (Handiwork/Transport 1) as early crafters/haulers.
Catch Foxparks (Kindling 1). Its harness (via Pal Gear Workbench) powers cooking/furnaces.
Catch Pengullet (Watering 1, Cooling 1). Great for crops and later the Mill.
Catch Daedream (strong early fighter; Lv 8 necklace partner skill is fun).
Optionally catch Vixy (coins from digging) and Tanzee (Lumber+Transport).
Grab Lifmunk Effigies when you see them and feed the Statue of Power for better catch odds.

chapters.title: Chapter 2 — Move Faster, Smelt Ore, First Mount (Lv 6–13)
chapters.why: Mobility + Ingots unlock real crafting. Get your first ride, first Ingots, and Crossbow before Tower 1.

steps.text: Build a Primitive Furnace (Lv 10) and start Ingots (assign Foxparks for Kindling).
Craft a Grappling Gun (Lv 12) to help with terrain (kid-friendly).
Craft a Crossbow (Lv 13). Big upgrade over the Bow.
Catch Rushoar (Ground; first saddle at Lv 6). Good vs Electric and can mine while mounted.
Catch Direhowl (fast ground mount; Lv 9 saddle). Great kid‑fun speed boost.
Dip into 1–2 nearby dungeons for chests and the chance at Skill Fruits (save for later).

chapters.title: Chapter 3 — Tower 1: Zoe & Grizzbolt (Lv ~10, Electric → weak to Ground)
chapters.why: You have Crossbow and a Ground pal. This gives Ancient Tech Points and confidence for the loop.

steps.text: Bring Rushoar (Ground) and healing items.
Spend a few Lifmunk Effigies at the Statue of Power to raise Capture Power.
Clear Rayne Tower — Zoe & Grizzbolt.

map.title: Rayne Syndicate Tower
map.label: Rayne Tower
kid: Ride south of the Plateau of Beginnings until you see the big tower with lightning sparks.
grown: The Rayne Syndicate Tower overlooks the Windswept Hills around (112, -434). Bring Ground pals for Zoe & Grizzbolt.

steps.text: Spend your Ancient Tech Points on quality-of-life you like (optional).

chapters.title: Chapter 4 — Farm → Cake → Breeding (Lv 14–20)
chapters.why: Breeding enables passive inheritance and specialized workers/mounts. Stand up a Cake factory and start Pal improvements.

steps.text: Build Sphere Workbench (Lv 14) to craft Mega Spheres for higher catch rates.
Build Wheat Plantation + Mill (Lv 15). Assign Planting/Watering pals (Pengullet runs the Mill).
Place a Ranch (Lv 5) and add Chikipi (Eggs), Mozzarina (Milk), Beegarde (Honey). You can also buy Milk from merchants if needed.
Build Cooking Pot (Lv 17) and craft Cake (Flour, Red Berries, Milk, Eggs, Honey).
Build Breeding Farm (Lv 19) and place Cake in its chest to start breeding.
Catch Penking (great multi‑job worker: Watering, Mining, Cooling, Handiwork, Transport 2).
Begin breeding for passives: Swift/Runner for mounts, Artisan/Serious for workers, Legend for strong combat. (Optional deepening.)

chapters.title: Chapter 5 — Mobility & Climate Prep → Tower 2: Lily & Lyleen (Lv ~18–25)
chapters.why: A first flyer + cold/heat gear make travel fun and safe for a child; Fire counters this tower.

steps.text: Craft Heat‑Resistant Pelt Armor (Lv 16) and Cold‑Resistant Pelt Armor (Lv 18) as needed.
Catch Nitewing (first flying mount) and craft its Saddle (Lv 15).
Ensure you have a solid Fire attacker for this tower (Foxparks can carry early).
Clear Free Pal Alliance Tower — Lily & Lyleen (weak to Fire).

map.title: Free Pal Alliance Tower
map.label: Lily & Lyleen
kid: Head into the snowy Free Pal Alliance base near the big crystal trees.
grown: The Free Pal Alliance Tower stands at roughly (185, 28) amid the frozen north. Pack heat gear and Fire pals.

chapters.title: Chapter 6 — Industrial Takeoff (Lv 20–26)
chapters.why: Guns, research, and ore automation accelerate everything before the volcano/desert legs.

steps.text: Build Weapon Workbench (Lv 20), unlock Musket (Lv 21) and craft Gunpowder.
Build Pal Labor Research Laboratory (Lv 20). Assign Pals with matching work skills to speed research.
Unlock Ore Mining Site (Lv 25) and place it near your base for passive ore.
Catch Digtoise (Mining Lv 3) to drive your ore economy.
Add a strong Lumbering Pal (e.g., Tanzee or Mammorest line) and a flyer as a hauler.

chapters.title: Chapter 7 — Tower 3: Axel & Orserk (Volcano; weak to Ice or Ground) (Lv ~30–40)
chapters.why: With ore, research, and a musket, the volcano is manageable. Bring Ice or Ground.

steps.text: Equip heat protection for the approach.
Field Ground (Rushoar/Digtoise) or an Ice attacker.
Clear Eternal Pyre Tower — Axel & Orserk.

map.title: Brothers of the Eternal Pyre Tower
map.label: Eternal Pyre
kid: Sail to the big volcano island and look for the glowing tower in the lava fields.
grown: Axel & Orserk wait on Mount Obsidian near (-560, -518). Bring cooling gear or water mounts for the lava run.

chapters.title: Chapter 8 — Assembly Lines & Better Spheres (Lv 28–36)
chapters.why: Catching late‑game Pals gets much easier with better spheres and production lines.

steps.text: Build Sphere Assembly Line → craft Hyper Spheres.
At Lv 35, unlock Ultra Spheres and Sphere Assembly Line II.
Build Weapon Assembly Line (Lv 32). Upgrade bows/ranged while climbing toward rifles.
Upgrade to Improved Furnace (Lv 34) for faster ore processing.
Catch a Water DPS (Azurobe or Jormuntide line) to prep for the next Fire tower.
Breed/assemble a Transport team (fliers make great haulers) to avoid factory clogs.

chapters.title: Chapter 9 — Tower 4: Marcus & Faleris (Desert; weak to Water) (Lv ~40–45)
chapters.why: Your Water team is ready; bring Water to counter Fire.

steps.text: Equip heat protection for travel.
Field Water attackers with decent spheres.
Clear PIDF Tower — Marcus & Faleris.

map.title: PIDF Tower
map.label: PIDF HQ
kid: Zip through the desert base full of robots—look for the tall tower with red lights.
grown: The PIDF desert headquarters is around (350, -200). Carry heat and cold protection for Marcus & Faleris.

chapters.title: Chapter 10 — Refined Metals & Rifle Era (Lv 41–46)
chapters.why: High‑tier armor/weaponry smooth the last towers.

steps.text: Unlock Electric Kitchen (Lv 41) to speed up Cake and cooking.
Build Electric Furnace and craft Legendary Spheres (Lv 44).
Craft an Assault Rifle (Lv 45) and ammo at the assembly line.
Catch or breed for Anubis (alpha spawn; Handiwork 4) to foreman your crafting lines.

chapters.title: Chapter 11 — Tower 5: Victor & Shadowbeak (Dark; weak to Dragon) (Lv ~50)
chapters.why: By now you’re armored and armed. Dragon counters Dark cleanly.

steps.text: Field a Dragon DPS (Astegon/Jetragon or any solid Dragon).
Clear PAL Genetic Research Unit — Victor & Shadowbeak.

map.title: PAL Genetic Research Unit
map.label: Victor & Shadowbeak
kid: Fly into the snowy science lab glowing above the frozen cliffs.
grown: Victor hides in the PAL Genetic Research Unit at about (558, 340). Bring Dragon pals and heavy cold gear.

chapters.title: Chapter 12 — Tower 6: Saya & Selyne (weak to Dragon) (Lv ~55)
chapters.why: Selyne is also weak to Dragon—reuse your Dragon plan.

steps.text: Bring your Dragon DPS and climate gear as needed.
Clear Sakurajima Tower — Saya & Selyne.

map.title: Moonflower Tower
map.label: Sakurajima
kid: Glide onto the pink island and follow the glowing petals to the Moonflower cult tower.
grown: Saya & Selyne occupy Moonflower Tower on Sakurajima near (640, 120). Pack antidotes for the toxic mists.

chapters.title: Chapter 13 — Tower 7: Bjorn & Bastigor (weak to Fire) (Lv ~60)
chapters.why: Final tower—swap back to Fire and finish the run.

steps.text: Bring strong Fire attackers and top‑tier gear/spheres.
Clear Feybreak Tower — Bjorn & Bastigor. 🎉

map.title: Feybreak Tower
map.label: Bjorn & Bastigor
kid: Finish the adventure on the snowy Feybreak island tower after beating the night pals.
grown: Bjorn & Bastigor guard Feybreak Tower around (512, -662). Bring legendary fire pals and plenty of heat support.
